org.threadly.litesockets.utils

Class TransactionalByteBuffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.utils.MergedByteBuffers
      • org.threadly.litesockets.utils.TransactionalByteBuffers

  • public class TransactionalByteBuffers
extends MergedByteBuffers
    This allows you to used MergedByteBuffers in a transactional way. This can be useful when reading from the socket using a protocol that is not framed. NOTE: If you are modifying the data in the underlying byteArrays that will not be reverted

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.threadly.litesockets.utils.MergedByteBuffers

    • Constructor Detail

      • TransactionalByteBuffers

        public TransactionalByteBuffers()

    • Method Detail

      • begin

        public void begin()
        This mark the beginning of a new transaction. anything done from this point can either be committed or rolled back and forgotten. If an operation is done with out using begin it is committed immediately on completion.

      • commit

        public void commit()
        Commit a already started transaction. Until this is done anything pulled out of the consolidator can be reverted. once this happens all changes are permanent and forever.

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
        This allows you to roll back all operations done on the consolidator since the begin was called. NOTE: If you are modifying the data in the underlying byteArrays that will not be reverted

      • get

        public byte get()
        Description copied from class: MergedByteBuffers
        Returns the next byte stored in the consolidator.
        Overrides:
        get in class MergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        the next single Byte from the consolidator.

      • get

        public void get(byte[] destBytes)
        Overrides:
        get in class MergedByteBuffers
        Parameters:
        destBytes - - fills the given byteArray with the next bytes from the consolidator. NOTE: do not give a byteArray bigger then the remaining size left in the consolidator.

      • getShort

        public short getShort()
        Description copied from class: MergedByteBuffers

      • pop

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer pop()
        Description copied from class: MergedByteBuffers
        Get the next Complete ByteBuffer in its entirety. This byteBuffer could be any size and it will just pull it off the queue and return it.
        Overrides:
        pop in class MergedByteBuffers
        Returns:
        the next byteBuffer in the queue.

      • pull

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer pull(int size)
        Overrides:
        pull in class MergedByteBuffers
        Parameters:
        size - - size to pull out of the consolidator as a ByteBuffer.
        Returns:
        a ByteBuffer of the next %SIZE% bytes.

      • discard

        public void discard(int size)
        Description copied from class: MergedByteBuffers
        discard just drops how ever many bytes you tell it to on the floor
        Overrides:
        discard in class MergedByteBuffers
        Parameters:
